security roll out high cpu usage roll out high cpu usage hello year regarding amp normal take about cpu usage when laptop idle when use laptop for work increase or more none colleagues around experience such issues most them have around something amp usage when idle more information could be seen attached file cheers sent december roll out importance high dear colleagues starting year embarked journey adopt best class technical response ever growing demand regards information after extensive preparation we re ready start phase wide there be gradual require your help understanding please bear with part programme we replace our current solution with anti end client amp during following days or your laptop join corporate case you were away installation automatically start background with interaction required however prompt you restart your computer complete process you be able postpone restart more convenient but please delay more than avoid forced restart eventually be performed make remain protected times order make transition smooth possible amp be running parallel with mode until old solution be decommissioned by end month there should be impact or visible change your station however please report any problem should you notice any strange behavior please watch space for future announcements additional be introduced following months always our teams myself here pick up any questions or concerns best regards manager

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing IT ticket**

I need to categorize this IT ticket into one of the provided categories: "Hardware," "HR Support," "Access," "Miscellaneous," "Storage," "Purchase," "Internal Project," or "Administrative rights." The ticket mentions a security rollout and issues with high and idle CPU usage. It seems related to replacing the current solution with an anti-endpoint client. Based on this, I’ll select the most appropriate category for efficient handling. This will help in directing the ticket to the right team.**Understanding the IT assignment**

I see that the message discusses the automatic installation of a new corporate case related to an IT security rollout, requiring a restart of the computer. There’s mention of high CPU usage and it seems to involve a new antivirus or endpoint client. I'm contemplating whether to categorize this as "Administrative rights" or possibly "Internal Project," although it doesn’t seem to fit either perfectly. Clarifying the right category is essential for ensuring proper handling.**Determining ticket categorization**

This is a rollout of a security agent as part of an internal project. I’m considering "Miscellaneous" as a category, but let's examine the options: Hardware, HR Support, Access, Storage, Purchase, Internal Project, Administrative rights, and Miscellaneous. The content suggests that there's a high CPU usage issue due to this rollout. The ticket discusses installation and restart prompts, which point towards IT management and deployment. I think "Internal Project" fits best because it reflects the ongoing security rollout, though "Miscellaneous" could also work since it doesn’t fit neatly into other categories.**Finalizing the categorization**

I need to clarify that the "Access" category isn’t suitable since it pertains to user permissions, which isn’t the issue here. "Hardware" would imply a hardware failure, but the ticket focuses on CPU usage linked to a software rollout, not a hardware problem. Therefore, "Internal Project" fits best for this IT ticket regarding deployment. I’ll format the response as JSON, ensuring to follow the required structure precisely. My final output will be:  

{"category":"Internal Project"}

I might consider adding a brief justification, but the categorization is clear!**Preparing the JSON response**

The user has asked me to categorize the issue, and I see that the required format is a JSON object with only the necessary information—no additional text allowed. I'll make sure to stick to the instructions precisely. My final response will focus solely on providing the JSON output with the "category" field included. I’m ready to deliver it now! Here’s the concise output as required:
  
{"category":"Internal Project"}
